noun.description: The action of anointing someone with oil or ointment as a religious rite or as a symbol of investiture as a monarch.
Treatment with a medicinal oil or ointment.
A manner of expression arising or apparently arising from deep emotion, especially as intended to flatter.
examples: he spoke the last two words with exaggerated unction

origin: Late Middle English: from Latin unctio(n-), from unguere anoint. unction (sense 3) arises from the link between religious fervor and anointing with the Holy Spirit.
